title: Quick Thai Curry with Chicken, Bell Pepper, and Fine Peanut Note
ingredients: 1 piece ginger root, about thumb-sized, peeled and finely chopped
1 tbsp red Thai curry paste, or less
1 small jar bamboo shoots, about 175 g, well-drained, sliced
10 baby corn from a jar, halved lengthwise
1 tsp palm sugar, alternatively brown sugar
1 tsp lemongrass paste or finely chopped lemongrass
500 g jasmine rice or aromatic rice
instructions: Mix the meat with 1 tbsp oil, soy sauce, and ginger, and marinate for about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, clean and cut the vegetables. Quickly fry the meat in a non-stick frying pan and set aside. In a wok or large pan with high sides, roast the curry paste in the remaining oil. Stir in the peanut butter and let it melt. Deglaze with coconut milk and add the vegetables. Let everything simmer for about 15 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the rice according to the package instructions. Just before the cooking time is up, add the meat and heat briefly. Season the curry with palm sugar, fish sauce (or a bit of salt), and lemongrass paste (which should not boil). Optionally sprinkle with Thai basil and serve with rice.
